destinations.name: Moc Chau
destinations.description: Need a quick “Green“ fix? Then a few days in Moc Chau is just what the doctor ordered. Crowned “World’s Leading Regional Nature Destination“ by the 2022 World Travel Awards, Moc Chau provides a year-round, weather accommodating bounty. Located in the northern province of Son La (about 200km from Hanoi), Moc Chau is known as the “Green Pearl.”

to_stay.name: The November - Moc Chau
to_stay.description: The November - Moc Chau is a homestay in Moc Chau, Vietnam, known for its serene garden views and stress-free environment. It offers free WiFi and private parking. Each unit is equipped with a terrace and a private bathroom stocked with essentials. Guests can unwind by the outdoor fireplace or enjoy the picnic area. The homestay also caters to children with an indoor play area and outdoor play equipment. It’s praised for its cozy atmosphere, clean rooms, and good value for money.

location.address: Số 88, Ngõ 3, Tiểu khu 34, xã Đông Sang, Mộc Châu, Mộc Châu, Việt Nam

to_stay.name: Sol Inn - Moc Chau
to_stay.description: Boasting a garden, a year-round outdoor pool and pool views, Sol Inn - Moc Chau is located in Mộc Châu. This property offers access to a balcony, free private parking and free WiFi. Featuring family rooms, this property also provides guests with an outdoor fireplace[^1^][11].

location.address: Số 186, ngõ 12, Bản Áng, Đông Sang, Mộc Châu, Sơn La[^2^][10]

to_stay.name: Mộc Châu Island - The Bullet Hotel
to_stay.description: Moc Chau Island is home to Vietnam’s new coolest attraction; a 632-meter-long glass bridge that has already been crowned with a Guinness World Book of Records title! The island itself is a fun place to visit for all the family, with zip-lining opportunities, arcades, entertainment, and places to eat[^3^][21].

location.address: Bản Lùn, Xã Mường Sang, Huyện Mộc Châu, Tỉnh Sơn La

to_stay.name: Vườn An nhiên Mộc Châu
to_stay.description: Vườn An nhiên Mộc Châu is a homestay located in Mộc Châu, Sơn La, Vietnam. It offers accommodations in a quiet area with clean facilities. The homestay is surrounded by a beautiful garden, and some accommodations include a terrace with mountain views, a fully equipped kitchen, and a private bathroom. The homestay provides free private parking, a 24-hour front desk, and free WiFi. It also features a shared kitchen and full-day security for guests. Buffet and continental breakfast options with warm dishes and local specialties are available each morning.

location.address: 37 Bản Áng 3, Đông Sang, Mộc Châu, Sơn La 34719, Vietnam

to_visit.name: Moc Chau Tea Hills
to_visit.description: Moc Chau Tea Hills are located in the Moc Chau Plateau, which is an ideal location for tea planting, animal husbandry, and other agriculture. The tea hills have become one of the most highlighted tourist destinations in the area. The tea hills lie about 15km away from Moc Chau Farm and are captivating with the green rows of tea trees running hill after hill. The whole landscape becomes even more vivid when the sunlight casts down on the hills.
to_visit.tips: The best time to visit is during the summer for a great photoshoot.

to_visit.name: Hua Tat Village
to_visit.description: Hua Tat Village is a lovely small community of the H'mong tribe in Moc Chau, blessed with lush, breathtaking scenery, authentic local culture, and a poetic trekking path into a nearby pine forest. The village is home to friendly H'mong villagers who have preserved their indigenous culture and tradition. The village also offers a unique experience of trekking the Pine Tree Trail, visiting the H'mong Cooking Workshop, and trying out the art of H'mong Embroidery and paper-making at the H'moong Paper Workshop.

location.address: Van Ho, Moc Chau, Son La, Vietnam

to_visit.tips: Visitors should meet the H'mong people, trek the Pine Tree Trail, visit the H'mong Cooking Workshop, enter the world of H'mong Embroidery, and try making paper at the H'moong Paper Workshop.

to_visit.name: Doi (Bat) Cave
to_visit.description: Doi Cave, also known as “Nguom Ca Khao”, is located on the slope of a limestone mountain about 700m from the public road. The cave is home to ten bat species, two of which are nationally endangered. The cave is mysterious and wild, with a marked inter-month fluctuation in the total bat abundance. It’s a fascinating place for nature lovers and those interested in biodiversity.
to_visit.tips: The cave is a natural habitat for bats, so visitors should respect the wildlife and not disturb the bats. Also, as the cave is quite dark and slippery, it’s recommended to bring a flashlight and wear appropriate footwear.

to_visit.name: Dai Yem Waterfall
to_visit.description: Dai Yem Waterfall, also known as Pink Blouse Waterfall, is a beautiful two-level waterfall with a drop at a height of 50m. The waterfall is created by the two streams of Vat and Bo Sap. It’s especially spectacular in the rainy season between April and September. The waterfall cascades down from a height of over 100 meters, creating a misty veil of water that shrouds the area in a dreamy haze.

location.address: Muong Sang, Moc Chau, Son La, Vietnam

to_visit.tips: The waterfall is a popular tourist destination and is easily accessible. Visitors can swim behind the falls and around them. The water is clean and is an amazing blue/green color. They also have bamboo rafts you can tow (on ropes) over to the falls if you don’t want to swim but do want to get up close and personal.

to_visit.name: Pa Phach Village
to_visit.description: Ba Phach Village is an iconic tribal village in Moc Chau Plateau. It is well-known for its spectacular sights of plump and peach flowers blooming in springtime and cauliflower blooming from November to December. The village is home to two ethnic groups – Thai people and H’mong people, each with their rich cultural customs and traditions. The village is divided into Lower Ba Phach, inhabited by the Thai, and Upper Ba Phach, inhabited by the H’mong people.

location.address: Dong Sang, Moc Chau, Son La, Vietnam

to_visit.tips: Visitors should respect the local customs and traditions. It's also recommended to visit during the springtime to see the beautiful blooming flowers.

to_visit.name: Na Ka Plum Valley
to_visit.description: Na Ka Valley, nestled in Moc Chau, is a paradise known for its picturesque plum trees. The valley's breathtaking landscape, fresh mountain air, and juicy plums make it a must-visit spot for travelers. The best time to visit Na Ka Plum Valley is from January to February, during the spring season in Moc Chau. From April onwards, it is summer and also the plum harvest season.
to_visit.tips: The best time to visit is during the plum harvest season. Visitors can participate in the plum harvest and enjoy the fresh plums.

to_eat.name: Nhà Hàng A Páo Mộc Châu
to_eat.description: Nhà Hàng A Páo Mộc Châu is a popular restaurant in Moc Chau, known for its delicious local cuisine. It's a great place to eat while visiting the Moc Chau Island.

to_eat.name: Tuan Gu Restaurant
to_eat.description: Tuan Gu Restaurant is a must-visit for food lovers in Moc Chau. The restaurant offers a variety of dishes that are sure to satisfy your taste buds.

to_eat.description: Restaurant 64 Moc Chau is a well-known restaurant in Moc Chau, offering a wide range of dishes. The restaurant is located near the Moc Chau Island, making it a convenient dining option for visitors.

to_eat.description: Chieng Di Salmon is a unique restaurant in Moc Chau that specializes in dishes made from salmon. The restaurant is located in the vicinity of Moc Chau Island, making it a great place to dine while exploring the island.

destinations.summary: Moc Chau Plateau, with its cool climate, tea plantations, and ethnic villages, is a perfect escape from bustling cities. Whether you’re sipping tea amidst rolling hills, exploring local traditions, or chasing waterfalls, Moc Chau promises a serene and unforgettable experience.
